description:
Even if you have a ton of outlets in your home, how many do you have by your desk? Not enough, probably. And that means you likely have a clunky power strip (or two) to handle all your devices and charging needs. But why get messy with power strips when you can keep everything centralized right at the outlet itself?

Consider something like this super-cute Addtam outlet extender with surge protection that’s only $8.99 right now (was $15.99) on Amazon with a Prime membership. (Don’t have Prime? You can still score this deal by signing up for a free 30-day Prime trial.) That’s a lovely 44 percent discount on a sleek, modern, and convenient accessory.

This is a 10-in-1 adapter, meaning you can plug in up to 10 devices and keep them all powe
title: Turn any wall outlet into 10 ports with this $9 surge protector

description: With Windows 11 versions 24H2 and 25H2, Microsoft is introducing a fundamentally revised Start Menu that runs on all devices with the same code base. The new functions are activated by an enablement package. This enables the new features without a complete reinstallation and makes the switch to Windows 11’s big 25H2 update as quick as a single restart.
title: Windows 11’s new-look Start menu is a big upgrade. Let’s dive in
